intro: Oplismenus semialatus, commonly known as the silverleaf fern, is a species of fern native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, silver-gray underside on its fronds, which gives it its common name. The plant has a creeping rhizome that allows it to spread along the ground, often forming dense mats. Its fronds are lanceolate and can reach up to 30 inches in length, with a leathery texture. Oplismenus semialatus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
